headline: Zenith bank
pros:
Job security
Strong prominent brand
Reasonable work-life balance
cons:
1. Very slow career growth, you may and likely will spend up to 5-7years on each grade/pay band before promotion. Especially if you are not a marketing staff.
2. Poor staff welfare. The bank did not review salary between 2014-2020 despite the fact that its profit was growing consistently year on year and cost of living for its staff rose astronomically. Healthcare is less than desirable with limited hospital coverage.
3. Profit share/bonus is shared arbitrarily to less than 30% of the staff. No criteria is ever communicated to staff, those deemed worthy of bonus simply wake up to see their accounts credited. Of course top management is guaranteed to receive bonus and a select few non-management staff who are performers.

headline: Zenith Bank is fast losing it's good talent
pros: Job security, industry average pay
cons: Working in operations is career hell, as you should expect to be promoted just once in 7 years, based on current criteria. You are only considered relevant if you are in sales/marketing, irrespective of how good you deliver your tasks and impress customers. All the good operations staff are currently leaving in droves. These days, you're left with an abundance of staff who can barely construct simple sentences without errors contained therein.

pros: My role taught me to be accurate, punctual, go the extra mile in service delivery and pay attention to  details.
cons: The welfare of the junior staff was nothing to write home about, and there is the issue favoritism when it comes to promotion. Not sure if appraisals were considered most times.

headline: In your best interest
pros: Good working environment , stable financial institution, top bank in nigeria, 5PM closing time to encourage worklife balance. Well respected in the sector.
cons: Sometimes it feels like the management are out to destroy the careers of young new recruits. The bank hardly promotes employees and focus only on maximizing profits at the detriment of the careers of their staff. Management keeps introducing new levels on the career ladder to further stagnate the progress of their staff. Leave applications continue to be denied by the bosses thus creating a scenario where members of staff cannot make plans for their leave and find themselves working over a year without utilizing their leave.

headline: Customer Service
pros: It was a good work environment overall. They worked like a family and a team. Although little issues existed but overall its a good place to start but not to stay for long.

Also there was lots of disagreement between customer service and marketers and without careful consideration they may make you loose your job if you're not thorough.
Finally, its not a good place to work long time as your job will keep being monotonous and promotion is very slow

headline: cash and teller , operations, teller job
pros: Zenith bank has good reputation and it is a strong brand which makes convincing customers in marketing not so hectic. Zenith bank is one of the strongest banks in Nigeria and also in Africa.
cons: Zenith bank marketing is tedious, lots of high expectations from management for staff to bring in the big names, blue chip companies, high networth individuals and the creme de LA creme of society and a lot of times not minding the extent people should go in pursuit of this. Hierarchy on the job is so much, one is almost subjected to boot licking. All staff work together to make profit for the bank yet profit is shared by a few branches or individuals.

headline: Relationship Manager in Ghana
pros: Zenith Bank in Ghana is a very fast paced environment which is great as a first job out of school. You get to learn a lot and have to remain self motivated to be successful.
cons: There is a lot of pressure to deliver with sometimes inadequate help. If you are not aggressive, the environment can get hostile very quickly.

headline: cso
pros: Superior customer service experience and exposure.
cons: Working without promotion or benefits

headline: Deputy Manager
pros: You learn to be a go getter
cons: Not enough training and limited career advancement

headline: Assistant Mgr
pros:
Dynamic environment
Good pay
Conducive office environment
cons:
No exit plan
top heavy
limited staff training opportunity

headline: Operations Staff
pros: Great staff trainings and self motivated staff
cons: Absence of work rotation and no career path

headline: Assistant banking officer
pros: Good for anyone that is willing to learn on the job especially in the IT department.  You will handle lots of big projects from day one and will have opportunities to work with employee from the very top and leading IT companies
cons: You work under pressure most of the times, and you may given assignment that you will have to deliver in short time.

headline: Overall review
pros: I enjoyed the time spent there. Perfect  atmosphere for commencing one's career.
cons: Most employees are disgruntled

headline: Motivating!
pros: You get to meet bright minds. Great place to work at. Beautiful salary.
cons: Long working hours and short or no break at all.

headline: Good pay, bad employee management relations
pros: Relatively good salary and allowances.
cons: Poor work ethic. Staff usually demoralised and lack motivation apart from salary.

headline: good place
pros:
average pay
flexible job
good staff
GOOD COLLEAGUES
proactive staff
cons:
sometimes bad managers
poor employee welfare

headline: Personal Banking Officer
pros: Competitive working environment and constant training.
cons: Too cut-throat and high pressured

headline: Interesting
pros: Opportunity of meeting and working with different people from all spheres of life.
cons: Not enough knowledge is passed around staff with respect to becoming a well grounded banker

headline: Great place to work
pros: I love fast paced offfice environment & Culture. You meet a lot of high net customers.Constant training and lots of exposure to help both individually and professionally. Definitely enjoyed working with Zenith
cons: Efforts are not recognized nor rewarded. Staff welfare & promotion is not of utmost importance to management. Its all about who you know or who's hands you are shaking

headline: Working here was worthwhile-worked in Ghana
pros: Well paid staff, excellence required, etc.
cons: Some processes can be long and stressful

headline: great career place
pros: great place to work and build a life
cons: reward is commensurate to hardwork

headline: Extremely nice place to work
pros: Learning development, Technology, Perfect integration of technology and Business for a company in a developing country
cons: Low Pay, slow promotion, non professional staff mostly ignored

headline: Friendly Atmosphere
pros: Good staff relations, staff are encouraged to develop self. Excellent customer services. Pay is not bad but can be better as the company is making so much profit.
cons: Slow career progression. Management places so much emphasis on marketing staffs neglecting operations staff.

headline: Great place to work and excel
pros: Good brand reputation for career erbt
cons: None I can think of

headline: Not so pleasant an experience..
pros: The upfront salary payments are about the only good reason I'd say..
cons: Professionalism, especially as regards marketing style leaves a lot to be desired..

headline: Senior executive assistant
pros: Great place to meet people, and may be make a few connections if you are lucky!
cons: You get lost in the midst of things, you lose ur career path, you lose your social life! There is no time for anything else but the job. Operators are overused, contract staff are underpaid, marketers have massive unattainable targets. Your best bet is to work in the special departments like FX, HR, Ebiz, IT; that way you can at least have some real banking experience on your CV.

headline: Relationship Banker
pros: Nice place to work than most places in the country
cons: Promotion is slow at work place.

headline: Great place to learn Machiavellian principles
pros:
Great place to learn marketing
A great place to become focused
Very visible brand
Great exposure to high net worth individuals
cons:
Limited opportunities to grow knowledge of banking transactions
Limited professional banking exposure
Top heavy
Salaries and bonuses can be changed suddenly
Limited career progression

headline: Just OK!
pros:
decent pay
quick promotion
networking opportunities to meet some of the country's top shots
cons:
Work life balance
stressful
unrealistic targets
long and late hours

headline: Top company
pros: Zenith Bank is the 2nd biggest bank in the country with branches all over the federation.
cons: They encourage more of self performance rather than team work.

headline: Zenith bank is an industry leader and a good Brand that will continue to stay at the top.
pros: Job security and good working environment.
cons: It takes too long to get promoted

headline: Zenith Bank is a "dog eat dog" environment, everyone is fighting for spot light
pros: Very great people to work with especially in the branches...average pay probably top 5 in the industry
cons: You wont  be paid all thats written on your appointment letter, management is shady and secretive and there is incessant fear of retrenchment.

headline: Pretty short, but long enough to know that its an OK place to begin a career
pros: Good brand name, well established career path, the management seem to be driven by profit generation
cons: Not too keen on staff welfare, as much as a company of its kind of pedigree should

headline: A wonderful experience
pros:
Great working Culture, you are groomed to be a good Customer Service Representative.
You are recognized for outstanding performance.
You meet a lot of high net worth Customers depending on your location
cons:
A lot of employees have been in one position for years without any promotion.
There was a mass layoff of employees from top management to bottom.
A lot of experienced and resourceful employees have left because they are frustrated with the management

headline: Employee bonding was great. Work conditions excluding remuneration were at a premium. It offers solid career opportunity
pros: The work environment is conducive. Learning on the job is done real time. Educational/academic aspirations of fellow employees constantly challenge you to want to improve on a daily.
cons: Remuneration is not as good as it should be. Their new policy makes staff overworked in a lot of areas because of under-staffing.

headline: Wonderful
pros: The pay is good pay. It also offers you an opportuinity to work with ots of young people with high goals and motivation
cons: It is time consuming. The branches in expensive places will pay u more allowance but the cost of living will take it up.

headline: A challenging place to work.
pros: (1) Good staff-relation at office (2) Professional work environment (3) Excellent customer service culture (4) Unparralel drive to accomplish target and projects on time (5) Good vacation/leave provisions (6) Improved staff trainings and re-trainings programmes.
cons: The bank's cons include heavy top management staff thereby making career growth blink for junior category staff who may seems to lose a sense of belonging.
